 39namespace vsip

 41namespace impl

 44template <typename T, symmetry_type S, obj_state C> 
 45class Fir_impl : public Fir_backend<T, S, C>
 46{
 47  typedef Fir_backend<T, S, C> base;
 48  typedef Dense<1, T> block_type;
 49public:
 50  Fir_impl(aligned_array<T> kernel, length_type k, length_type i, length_type d)
 51    : base(i, k, d),
 52      skip_(0),
 53      kernel_(this->kernel_size()),
 54      state_(this->kernel_size(), T(0)),
 55      state_saved_(0)
 56  {
 57    // spec says a nonsym kernel size has to be >1, but symmetric can be ==1:
 58    assert(k > (S == nonsym));
 59    // mirror the kernel
 60    Dense<1, T> kernel_block(k, kernel.get());
 61    kernel_block.admit();
 62    Vector<T> tmp(kernel_block);
 63    this->kernel_(Domain<1>(this->order_, -1, k)) = tmp;
 64    // and maybe unmirror a copy, too
 65    if (S != nonsym) this->kernel_(Domain<1>(k)) = tmp;
 66    kernel_block.release(false);
 67  }
 68
 69  Fir_impl(Fir_impl const &fir)
 70    : base(fir),
 71      skip_(fir.skip_),
 72      kernel_(fir.kernel_),
 73      state_(fir.state_.get(Domain<1>(fir.state_.size()))), // deep copy
 74      state_saved_(fir.state_saved_)
 75  {}
 76  virtual Fir_impl *clone() { return new Fir_impl(*this);}
 77
 78  length_type apply(T *in, stride_type in_stride, length_type in_length,
 79                    T *out, stride_type out_stride, length_type out_length)
 80  {
 81    typedef impl::Subset_block<Dense<1, T> > block_type;
 82    typedef Vector<T, block_type> view_type;
 83
 84    length_type in_extent = abs(in_stride) * (in_length - 1) + 1;
 85    Dense<1, T> in_block(in_extent, in_stride > 0 ? in : in - in_extent + 1);
 86    block_type sub_in_block(Domain<1>(in_stride > 0 ? 0 : in_extent - 1,
 87                                      in_stride, in_length), in_block);
 88    view_type input(sub_in_block);
 89
 90    length_type out_extent = abs(out_stride) * (out_length - 1) + 1;
 91    Dense<1, T> out_block(out_extent, out_stride > 0 ? out : out - out_extent + 1);
 92    block_type sub_out_block(Domain<1>(out_stride > 0 ? 0 : out_extent - 1,
 93                                       out_stride, out_length), out_block);
 94    view_type output(sub_out_block);
 95
 96    length_type const dec = this->decimation();
 97    length_type const m = this->order_;
 98    length_type const skip = this->skip_;
 99    length_type const saved = this->state_saved_;
100    length_type oix = 0;
101    length_type i = 0;
102
103    in_block.admit(true);
104    out_block.admit(false);
105
106    for (; i < m - skip; ++oix, i += dec)
107    {
108      // Conceptually this comes second, but it's more convenient
109      // to put it here.  So, read the second statement below first.
110      T sum = dot(this->kernel_(Domain<1>(m - skip - i, 1, i + skip + 1)),
111                  input(Domain<1>(i + skip + 1)));
112      
113      if (C == state_save && i < saved)
114        sum += dot(this->kernel_(Domain<1>(saved - i)),
115                   this->state_(Domain<1>(i, 1, saved - i)));
116      output.put(oix, sum);
117    }
118	  
119    length_type start = i - (m - skip);
120    for ( ; start + m < this->input_size_; ++oix, start += dec)
121    {
122      T sum = dot(this->kernel_, input(Domain<1>(start, 1, m + 1)));
123      output.put(oix, sum);
124    }
125
126    if (C == state_save)
127    {
128      this->skip_ = start + m - this->input_size_;
129      // Invariant: (this->input_size % dec == 0) => (this->skip_ == 0)
130      assert(this->input_size_ % dec != 0 || this->skip_ == 0);
131      length_type const new_save = this->input_size_ - start;
132      this->state_saved_ = new_save;
133      this->state_(Domain<1>(new_save)) = input(Domain<1>(start, 1, new_save));
134    }
135
136    in_block.release(false);
137    out_block.release(true);
138
139    return oix;
140  }
141
142  virtual void reset() VSIP_NOTHROW
143  {
144    state_saved_ = skip_ = 0;
145    state_ = T(0);
146  }
147
148  virtual char const* name() { return "fir-opt"; }
149
150private:
151  length_type skip_;          // how much of next input to skip
152  Vector<T, block_type> kernel_; 
153  Vector<T, block_type> state_;
154  length_type state_saved_;   // number of elements saved
155};
156
157
158
159/// Create FIR kernel from coefficients
160///
161/// Requires:
162///   :p_coeff: to be a pointer to FIR coefficients.
163///   :n_coeff: to be the number of FIR coefficients.
164///   :n_kernel: to be the kernel size.
165///
166/// Returns a vector of kernel coefficients, mirrored and with
167///   necessary symmetry applied
168template <typename      T,
169	  typename      BlockT,
170	  symmetry_type S>
171Vector<T, BlockT>
172create_kernel(
173  T*          p_coeff,
174  length_type n_coeff,
175  length_type n_kernel)
176{
177  Vector<T, BlockT> kernel(n_kernel);
178
179  // mirror the kernel
180  Dense<1, T> coeff_block(n_coeff, p_coeff);
181  coeff_block.admit();
182  Vector<T> coeff(coeff_block);
183  kernel(Domain<1>(n_kernel-1, -1, n_coeff)) = coeff;
184  // and maybe unmirror a copy, too
185  if (S != nonsym) kernel(Domain<1>(n_coeff)) = coeff;
186  coeff_block.release(false);
187
188  return kernel;
189}
190
191
192
193// Fir implementation, based on convolution
194
195template <typename T, symmetry_type S, obj_state C> 
196class Fir_conv_impl : public Fir_backend<T, S, C>
197{
198  typedef Fir_backend<T, S, C> base;
199  typedef Dense<1, T> block_type;
200
201  static length_type conv_size(length_type input_size, length_type order, length_type dec)
202  {
203    return input_size - (order%dec ? (dec-order%dec) : 0);
204  }
205
206public:
207  Fir_conv_impl(
208    aligned_array<T> kernel,
209    length_type      k,
210    length_type      i,
211    length_type      d)
212  : base        (i, k, d),
213    skip_       (0),
214    kernel_     (create_kernel<T, block_type, S>(kernel.get(), k, this->kernel_size())),
215    conv_kernel_(kernel_(Domain<1>(this->kernel_size()-1, -1,
216				   this->kernel_size()))),
217    state_      (this->kernel_size(), T(0)),
218    state_saved_(0),
219    conv_       (conv_kernel_, conv_size(i, this->order_, d), d)
220  {
221    assert(i % d == 0);
222
223    // spec says a nonsym kernel size has to be >1, but symmetric can be ==1:
224    assert(k > (S == nonsym));
225  }
226
227  Fir_conv_impl(Fir_conv_impl const &fir)
228    : base(fir),
229      skip_(fir.skip_),
230      kernel_(fir.kernel_),
231      conv_kernel_(fir.conv_kernel_),
232      state_(fir.state_.get(Domain<1>(fir.state_.size()))), // deep copy
233      state_saved_(fir.state_saved_),
234      conv_       (conv_kernel_, this->input_size_-(this->order_%this->decimation_ ? (this->decimation_-this->order_%this->decimation_) : 0), this->decimation_)
235  {}
236  virtual Fir_conv_impl *clone() { return new Fir_conv_impl(*this);}
237
238  length_type apply(T *in, stride_type in_stride, length_type in_length,
239                    T *out, stride_type out_stride, length_type out_length)
240  {
241    typedef impl::Subset_block<Dense<1, T> > block_type;
242    typedef Vector<T, block_type> view_type;
243
244    Dense<1, T> in_block(in_stride * (in_length - 1) + 1, in);
245    block_type sub_in_block(Domain<1>(0, in_stride, in_length), in_block);
246    view_type input(sub_in_block);
247
248    Dense<1, T> out_block(out_stride * (out_length - 1) + 1, out);
249    block_type sub_out_block(Domain<1>(0, out_stride, out_length), out_block);
250    view_type output(sub_out_block);
251
252    length_type const dec = this->decimation();
253    length_type const m = this->order_;
254    length_type const skip = this->skip_;
255    length_type const saved = this->state_saved_;
256    length_type oix = 0;
257    length_type i = 0;
258
259    in_block.admit(true);
260    out_block.admit(false);
261
262    for (; i < m - skip; ++oix, i += dec)
263    {
264      // Conceptually this comes second, but it's more convenient
265      // to put it here.  So, read the second statement below first.
266      T sum = dot(this->kernel_(Domain<1>(m - skip - i, 1, i + skip + 1)),
267                  input(Domain<1>(i + skip + 1)));
268      
269      if (C == state_save && i < saved)
270        sum += dot(this->kernel_(Domain<1>(saved - i)),
271                   this->state_(Domain<1>(i, 1, saved - i)));
272      output.put(oix, sum);
273    }
274	  
275    length_type start = i - (m - skip);
276    assert(start == (((m-skip) % dec) ? (dec-(m-skip)%dec) : 0));
277    if (start + m < this->input_size_)
278    {
279      length_type out_size =   (this->input_size_ - (start + m)) / dec
280	                   + (((this->input_size_ - (start + m)) % dec) ? 1:0);
281      conv_(input(Domain<1>(start, 1, this->input_size_-start)),
282	   output(Domain<1>(oix, 1, out_size)));
283
284      length_type x = this->input_size_-(start+m);
285      start += x + (x % dec ? (dec-x%dec) : 0);
286      oix += out_size;
287    }
288
289    if (C == state_save)
290    {
291      this->skip_ = start + m - this->input_size_;
292      // Invariant: (this->input_size % dec == 0) => (this->skip_ == 0)
293      assert(this->input_size_ % dec != 0 || this->skip_ == 0);
294      length_type const new_save = this->input_size_ - start;
295      this->state_saved_ = new_save;
296      this->state_(Domain<1>(new_save)) = input(Domain<1>(start, 1, new_save));
297    }
298
299    in_block.release(false);
300    out_block.release(true);
301
302    return oix;
303  }
304
305  virtual void reset() VSIP_NOTHROW
306  {
307    state_saved_ = skip_ = 0;
308    state_ = T(0);
309  }
310
311  virtual char const* name() { return "fir-conv-opt"; }
312
313private:
314  length_type skip_;          // how much of next input to skip
315  Vector<T, block_type> kernel_; 
316  Vector<T, block_type> conv_kernel_; 
317  Vector<T, block_type> state_;
318  length_type state_saved_;   // number of elements saved
319  vsip::Convolution<const_Vector, nonsym, support_min, T> conv_;
320};
321
322} // namespace vsip::impl
323} // namespace vsip
324
325namespace vsip_csl
326{
327namespace dispatcher
328{
329template <typename T, symmetry_type S, obj_state C> 
330struct Evaluator<op::fir, be::opt,
331                 impl::Ref_counted_ptr<impl::Fir_backend<T, S, C> >
332                 (impl::aligned_array<T>,
333                  length_type, length_type, length_type,
334                  unsigned, alg_hint_type)>
335{
336  static bool const ct_valid = true;
337  typedef impl::Ref_counted_ptr<impl::Fir_backend<T, S, C> > return_type;
338  // We pass a reference for the first argument 
339  // to not lose ownership of the data.
340  static bool rt_valid(impl::aligned_array<T> const &,
341                       length_type, length_type, length_type,
342                       unsigned, alg_hint_type)
343  { return true;}
344  static return_type exec(impl::aligned_array<T> k, length_type ks,
345                          length_type is, length_type d,
346                          unsigned, alg_hint_type)
347  {
348    length_type order = impl::Fir_backend<T, S, C>::order(ks);
349    length_type start = order%d ? (d-order%d) : 0;
350    
351    // Requirements for convolution-based Fir
352    //  - input size must be a multiple of the decimation,
353    //    otherwise the convolution size changes from frame to frame.
354    //  - input size must be greater than the "start" position + order,
355    //    otherwise the FIR is too small to perform convolution on a frame.
356    return (is%d == 0 && is > start + order)
357      ? return_type(new impl::Fir_conv_impl<T, S, C>(k, ks, is, d), impl::noincrement)
358      : return_type(new impl::Fir_impl<T, S, C>(k, ks, is, d), impl::noincrement);
359  }
360};
361
362} // namespace vsip_csl::dispatcher
363} // namespace vsip_csl
